long_desc.thetext:
Deprecate AST.JLS3. We only didn't do this originally because JLS4 was only added in a maintenance branch.
Also need to add a few JLS3_INTERNAL constants to hide deprecation warnings.
Ayush, thanks for taking this to closure.
Satyam, can you do a quick sanity check on this? Thanks!

I have only two comments: ReconcileContext.java: - Javadoc of ReconcileContext can change the usage of getAST3() to getAST4() - internalGetAST3() doesn't have to be created. Just change the test to use getAST4().
Otherwise, the changes look good.
Released in master via commit d5d80bf8463f6c0b6cb8067c68b421cb5ca1a549
Satyam, this bug is still marked as code review needed. Would you like to manifest your findings in the flag? :)
ReconcileContext#internalGetAST3() is still there and being marked as an API. Removed the API and removed the calls from the tests via commit eeeb5c4e12624718b8305ff27a189b9476439c87.

While reviewing (using code inspection) I was slightly confused in classes NaiveASTFlattener, ASTRewriteAnalyzer and ASTRewriteFlattener, which all have a private field mirroring the deprecated flag JLS2 from AST instead of directly accessing JLS2_INTERNAL. Might be clearer to use the same strategy for JLS3, too?
This finding made me wonder how hard it would be to make JLS3_INTERNAL package private? Mostly tests would be affected, ReconcileContext can actually use the deprecated flags JLS3 (inside the deprecated method getAST3()). Note that JLS2_INTERNAL *is* package private already.
I'm reopening to request better alignment with JLS2 and JLS2_INTERNAL (shouldn't be hard).
Released in master via commit d7f649048f20a2b7da85ffb34af89adc6b577de1
(In reply to comment #8) > (shouldn't be hard). Not hard, but took away too much time :(
Stephan, please review and verify the changes - TIA.
Verified for 3.8 M6 with build I20120314-1800 and HEAD.
Much cleaner, now. +1 from me, too.
